verbs.description: backtrack (third-person singular simple present backtracks, present participle backtracking, simple past and past participle backtracked)

examples: I dropped my sunglasses and had to backtrack to find them.

entries.meaning: To repeat or review work already done.
examples: If we backtrack through this problem, maybe we can figure out where we went wrong.

entries.meaning: (aviation) To taxi down an active runway in the opposite direction to that being used for takeoff.
examples: Speedbird One: enter and backtrack Runway 27 Left.

entries.meaning: To exercise a racehorse around the racetrack in the opposite direction to that in which races are run.
